abstract: Terrorist attacks in Paris have residents deeply concerned about risk of further violence; government will soon be forced to confront whether more intelligence or better security could have thwarted the plot against newspaper Charlie Hebdo and hostage situation that followed.
lead_paragraph: Friday was a day, like the previous two, of violence in and around Paris, one that ended with France unsure whether this drama is now truly over or a predictor of more cultural, religious and political violence to come.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

snippet: Friday was a day, like the previous two, of violence in and around Paris, one that ended with France unsure whether this drama is now truly over or a predictor of more cultural, religious and political violence to come.

headline.main: Days of Sirens, Fear and Blood: ‘France Is Turned Upside Down’
headline.print_headline: Days of Sirens, Fear and Blood: ‘France Is Turned Upside Down’
